page.title: 06Tourism
page.content: The principle attraction to this area is the Blithfield Resevoir. This brings tourists to participate in sailing and fishing but mainly to study the very many variety of birds who either ihabit the reservoir or rest there during migration. visitors come all the year round, some of course just to amire the beautiful expanse of water in an attractive rural setting. At week-ends during the summer visitors roam the lanes which encircle the reservoir, even ice-cream vans and hot-dog stands can be seen. At one time Blithfield Hall was open to the public and may be again in the near future. Over night accommodation is available at some farm house, the farmer's wives provide bed and breakfast at reasonable prices. Their guests are often visitors to Alton Tower & Linchfield.
